page.title: 15THE INCLINE
page.content:
Just passed the chapel near Ralegh's Cross you enter the Exmoor National Park and on the right hand side of the road is the famous incline. This is a relic of the days of iron ore mining in the Brendons and the iron used to be transported by rail down this mile long man made slope for shipping to South Wales. The remains of the winding house can still be seen as can the foundations of a row of miners cottages long since demolished. This is also the end of the now demolished Brendon Hill railway and you can still see the remains of the station.
The mining reached its peak about a hundred years ago and apart from the incline little trace of it now remains.
